summary: This bill, H.R. 400, titled the "No taxpayer funding for United Nations Human Rights Council Act," prohibits U.S. financial support for the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC). It directs the Secretary of State to withhold the portion of the United States' annual contribution to the UN's regular budget that would be allocated to the UNHRC. The act also forbids any voluntary U.S. contributions to the council. Any funds withheld under this act are permanently rescinded and will not be considered arrears owed to any United Nations entity.
